column1: The health care provider may hear a fast heartbeat while listening to your heart with a stethoscope.
An ECG (a test that records the electrical activity of the heart) may show atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter.
- Prevent atrial fibrillation from coming back: These drugs work well in many people, but they can have serious side effects.
Blood thinners are medicines that are used to reduce the risk of developing a blood clot that travels in the body (and that can cause a stroke, for example).
They include heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), apixaban (Eliquis), rivaroxaban (Xarelto), and dabigatran (Pradaxa).
Antiplatelet drugs such as aspirin or clopidogrel may also be prescribed.
Treatment can often control this disorder.
